page.title: 01D-BLOCK MAP REF:05480222.
page.content: The majority of the land is used for arable farming growing wheat and oil seed rape.Many fine trees blend into the{Essex}and{Herfordshire}countryside and are a notable feature of the area. There are four areas of population. {BIRCHANGER}:A small village with a church,school and social club. {FARNHAM}:Surrounded by farmland with a few thatched cottages and farms. {STANSTED MOUNTFITCHET}: Believed to be the largest village in Essex lying in an agriculural area but has developed into an attraction for access for commuters to London and Cambridge. The valleys of the River Stort and Stansted Brook form the major landscape elements to the west and new housing development to the north. {BISHOP'S STORTFORD}: The north part of the town has old and new houses, playing areas and a swimming pool.
